title: worried about ocean life? here's how to help | peta2
body: People and businesses everywhere are ditching plastic straws to help the environment, and that's great. Every tiny step in the right direction helps. But avoiding plastic straws is just that—a tiny step. As humans, we produce nearly 300 million tons of plastic every single year, and 14 million tons of it is dumped into our oceans annually.
readable_content: - Erin (2023-12-08): People and businesses are ditching plastic straws to help the environment, but this is just a tiny step in the right direction. Plastic straws make up only about 0.03% of the plastic that pollutes our seas. The most harmful form of marine debris is abandoned fishing gear, which kills millions of sea animals every year. Refusing to support the fishing industry is crucial to preventing further suffering and protecting marine animals. Cutting fish out of your diet can have a huge positive impact on the environment, save sea animals, and benefit your health.
summary:
The author advocates for a more significant environmental impact by addressing the issue of abandoned fishing gear and promoting the idea of cutting fish out of one's diet to protect marine animals. The sentiment is positive, promoting a proactive approach to protecting the environment.
